title: AB 1821
content:
The people of California enact the following. Section 667.61 of the Penal Code is amended to specify the punishment for certain offenses, including rape and spousal rape, with imprisonment in the state prison for 15 to 25 years to life depending on the circumstances. The amended Penal Code specifies punishment for various offenses, including spousal rape, sexual penetration, lewd acts, sodomy, oral copulation, and continuous sexual abuse of a child. The amended Penal Code specifies punishment for offenses such as spousal rape, sexual penetration, lewd acts, sodomy, oral copulation, and continuous sexual abuse of a child, including cases involving developmentally disabled victims. The Penal Code specifies punishment for offenses like spousal rape, sexual penetration, lewd acts, sodomy, and oral copulation involving developmentally disabled victims. Repeat offenders face stricter penalties. The defendant committed the present offense under aggravated circumstances, including kidnapping, mayhem or torture, first-degree burglary with intent to commit a specified offense, or violation of specific sections of the Penal Code involving aggravated acts. The defendant inflicted bodily harm on the victim, used a weapon or firearm, or committed the offense during a burglary. The defendant committed offenses against multiple victims, tied or bound victims, administered drugs, and violated specific sections of the law during the commission of the offense. If only the minimum circumstances required for a specific punishment have been proven, they will be used as the basis for imposing the greater term provided by law. Additional circumstances can lead to additional punishment. The minimum circumstances required for a specific punishment will be used as the basis for imposing the greater term provided by law, and any additional circumstances can lead to further punishment. Additional circumstances shall be used to impose any punishment or enhancement authorized under any other provision of law. The court shall not strike any allegation, admission, or finding of specified circumstances for those subject to punishment under this section. Probation or sentence suspension is not allowed for individuals subject to punishment under this section. Consecutive sentences must be imposed for offenses involving separate victims or the same victim on separate occasions. Any person convicted of specified offenses against a child under 14 years of age under certain circumstances faces life imprisonment without parole or 25 years to life in state prison. Probation or sentence suspension is not permitted for these individuals, and consecutive sentences are required for offenses involving separate victims or the same victim on separate occasions. Any person convicted of specified offenses against a minor 14 years of age or older under certain circumstances faces life imprisonment without parole or 25 years to life in state prison. Any person convicted of specified offenses against a minor 14 years of age or older shall be punished by imprisonment in the state prison for 25 years to life. SEC. 2.
Section 667.9 of the Penal Code is amended to read:
667.9. Section 667.9 of the Penal Code is amended to include enhancements for crimes committed against vulnerable individuals such as the elderly, disabled, or minors. Offenders will receive one-year enhancements for each violation, with a two-year enhancement for repeat offenses. The crimes covered include mayhem, kidnapping, and robbery. The Penal Code includes enhancements for crimes against vulnerable individuals like the elderly, disabled, or minors. Offenders face enhancements for various offenses such as robbery, carjacking, rape, spousal rape, sodomy, oral copulation, sexual penetration, and burglary. The term "developmentally disabled" is defined as a severe, chronic disability. The curr_chunk discusses the criteria for a condition to be considered a disability, including the need for it to be attributable to a mental or physical impairment, likely to continue indefinitely, and result in substantial functional limitations in various areas of life activity. The chunk also mentions that no reimbursement is required for this act as it pertains to changes in penalties for crimes.
